title: 108_hr2995
content: The Act may be cited as the "Social Security Deceased Beneficiary Act of 2003" and it ensures the continuation of benefits through the month of the beneficiary's death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Old-Age Insurance Benefits and Wife's Insurance Benefits, including changes to the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Husband's and Child's Insurance Benefits, including changes to the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Widow's and Widower's Insurance Benefits, including changes to the month of eligibility and redesignating subparagraphs. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust Mother's, Father's, and Parent's Insurance Benefits, including changes to eligibility months and conditions for remarriage or death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust benefits for parents, including changes related to eligibility months, remarriage, and death. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust benefits for parents, including changes related to eligibility months, remarriage, and death. Additionally, Section 202 of the Act is amended to include new subsections for old-age and survivors insurance benefits. The Social Security Act is amended to adjust benefits for parents, including changes related to eligibility months, remarriage, and death. Payment of monthly insurance benefits for the month of the beneficiary's death is specified in various sections of the Act. Payment for the month of a beneficiary's death is addressed in section 204(d) of the Social Security Act. The Act also includes provisions to disregard the benefit for the month of death under the family maximum provisions. These amendments are effective immediately. The amendments made by this Act will apply to deaths occurring after the month of enactment.
